name: esterification of rape oil | glycerine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4072/documentation

Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg rape rape methyl ester, respectively glycerine and potassium sulphate, from rape oil. The multioutput-process 'rape oil, in esterification plant' delivers the co-products 'rape methyl ester, at esterification plant', 'glycerine, from rape oil, at esterification plant', 'potassium sulphate, as K2O, from rape oil, at esterification plant'.



This process includes the esterification process of oil to methyl ester, glycerine and potassium sulphate, intermediate storage of the oil and products, treatment of specific wastewater effluents. System boundary is at the esterification plant.
category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/192:Manufacture of refined petroleum products/1920:Manufacture of refined petroleum products

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data from 1996 to 2003, current technology in the EU
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from different plants worldwide (incl. literature data)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical vegetable oil esterification plant designed for the production of methyl ester (for use in the vehicle fuels market), global context. Base-catalyzed transesterification.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: none This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography Europe without Switzerland. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Cross-checking of various literature sources from 1998 to 2006

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Literature, environmental report
Calculated based on literature (Sheenhan, J., 18, An Overview of Biodiesel and Petroleum Diesel Life Cycles; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Assumed to have the same water use as "soybean methyl ester, at esterification plant". The process starts when refined oil enters the plant. It includes the processes: prepurification, deacidification, transesterification, destilation, etc. It is assumed that 95% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 5% of water is allocated as process water.
Literature, environmental report
Calculated based on literature (Sheenhan, J., 18, An Overview of Biodiesel and Petroleum Diesel Life Cycles; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Assumed to have the same water use as "soybean methyl ester, at esterification plant". The process starts when refined oil enters the plant. It includes the processes: prepurification, deacidification, transesterification, destilation, etc. It is assumed that 95% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 5% of water is allocated as process water.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature (Sheenhan, J., 18, An Overview of Biodiesel and Petroleum Diesel Life Cycles; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Assumed to have the same water use as "soybean methyl ester, at esterification plant". The process starts when refined oil enters the plant. It includes the processes: prepurification, deacidification, transesterification, destilation, etc. The process ends when methyl ester leaves the plant. It is assumed that 95% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 5% of water is allocated as process water.
